channel.title: Posts on rraks
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on rraks

item.title: Review: Guards! Guards! by Terry Pratchet
item.description: They may be called the Palace Guard, the City Guard, or the Patrol. Whatever the name, their purpose in any work of heroic fantasy is identical: it is, round about Chapter Three (or ten minutes into the film) to rush into the room, attack the hero one at a time, and be slaughtered.

item.title: Review: The Left Hand Of Darkness by Ursula K Le Guin
item.description: The Left Hand of Darkness is a masterpiece in Science Fiction. Ursula conducts a thought experiment with her readers, as described in her own words -

item.title: Review: The Brothers Karamazov by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: To be of a Karamazovian nature is to be able to contemplate both abysses at once, that of the loftiest and most noble abyss above us and that of the one beneath us, the lowest and foulest of human degradation and thought.
